com.mapbox.mapboxsdk.annotations

Class MarkerView

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mapbox.mapboxsdk.annotations.Annotation
      • com.mapbox.mapboxsdk.annotations.Marker
        • com.mapbox.mapboxsdk.annotations.MarkerView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<Annotation>

    public class MarkerView
extends Marker
    MarkerView is an annotation that shows a View at a geographical location. The default marker uses a provided icon. This icon can be customized using IconFactory to generate an Icon using a provided image. MarkerViews are added to the map by first giving a LatLng and using MapboxMap.addMarker(BaseMarkerViewOptions). The marker view icon by default is anchored at the center bottom.

    If many markers are needed to be displayed on the map at once we suggest using Marker instead. This class uses MapboxMap.MarkerViewAdapter to adapt a MarkerView model to an Android SDK View object.

    MarkerViews are designed to be interactive. They receive click events by default, and are often used with event listeners to bring up info windows. An InfoWindow is displayed by default when either a title or snippet is provided.

      • MarkerView

        public MarkerView(BaseMarkerViewOptions baseMarkerViewOptions)
        Creates a instance of MarkerView using the builder of MarkerView
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • setAnchor

        public void setAnchor(float u,
                      float v)
        Specifies the anchor being set on a particular point of the MarkerView.

        The anchor point is specified in the continuous space [0.0, 1.0] x [0.0, 1.0], where (0, 0) is the top-left corner of the image, and (1, 1) is the bottom-right corner.

        Parameters:
        u - u-coordinate of the anchor, as a ratio of the image width (in the range [0, 1]).
        v - v-coordinate of the anchor, as a ratio of the image height (in the range [0, 1]).

      • getAnchorU

        public float getAnchorU()
        Get the horizontal distance, normalized to [0, 1], of the anchor from the left edge.
        Returns:
        The u-value of the anchor.

      • getAnchorV

        public float getAnchorV()
        Get the vertical distance, normalized to [0, 1], of the anchor from the top edge.
        Returns:
        the v-value of the anchor.

      • setInfoWindowAnchor

        public void setInfoWindowAnchor(float u,
                                float v)
        Specifies the anchor point of the info window on the View of the MarkerView.

        The anchor point is specified in the continuous space [0.0, 1.0] x [0.0, 1.0], where (0, 0) is the top-left corner of the image, and (1, 1) is the bottom-right corner.

        The default is the top middle of the View.

        Parameters:
        u - u-coordinate of the info window anchor, as a ratio of the image width (in the range [0, 1]).
        v - v-coordinate of the info window anchor, as a ratio of the image height (in the range [0, 1]).
        See Also:
        for more details.

      • getInfoWindowAnchorU

        public float getInfoWindowAnchorU()
        Get the horizontal distance, normalized to [0, 1], of the info window anchor from the left edge.
        Returns:
        the u value of the InfoWindow anchor.

      • getInfoWindowAnchorV

        public float getInfoWindowAnchorV()
        Get the vertical distance, normalized to [0, 1], of the info window anchor from the top edge.
        Returns:
        the v value of the InfoWindow anchor.

      • isFlat

        public boolean isFlat()
        Get the flat state of a MarkerView.
        Returns:
        true if the MarkerView is flat; false if the MarkerView is billboard.

      • setFlat

        public void setFlat(boolean flat)
        Sets whether this MarkerView should be flat against the map (true) or a billboard facing the camera (false).
        Parameters:
        flat - the flat state of the MarkerView.

      • setVisible

        public void setVisible(boolean visible)
        Set the visible state of a MarkerView.
        Parameters:
        visible - true will make the MarkerView visible, false will hide the MarkerView.

      • isVisible

        public boolean isVisible()
        Returns the visible state of the MarkerView.
        Returns:
        the visible state.

      • setRotation

        public void setRotation(float rotation)
        Set the rotation value of the MarkerView in degrees.

        Input will be limited to 0 - 360 degrees.

        This will result in animating the rotation of the MarkerView using an rotation animator from current value to the provided parameter value.

        Parameters:
        rotation - the rotation value to animate to.

      • getRotation

        public float getRotation()
        Get the rotation value of the MarkerView.
        Returns:
        the rotation value.

      • getAlpha

        public float getAlpha()
        Get the alpha value of the MarkerView.
        Returns:
        the alpha value.

      • setAlpha

        public void setAlpha(float alpha)
        Set the alpha value of the MarkerView.

        This will result in animating the alpha of the MarkerView using an alpha animator from current value to the provided parameter value.

        Parameters:
        alpha - the alpha value to animate to.

      • setMapboxMap

        public void setMapboxMap(MapboxMap mapboxMap)
        Set the MapboxMap associated tot the MapView containing the MarkerView.

        This method is used to instantiate the MarkerView and provide an instance of MapboxMap.MarkerViewAdapter

        This method is used to notify that a MarkerView is no longer active by setting a null value.

        Overrides:
        setMapboxMap in class Annotation
        Parameters:
        mapboxMap - the MapboxMap instances.
